sentence.Network_en: Doctors I came into contact with voiced their concern.
sentence.Network_cn: 我接触到的医生都表示了他们的担心。

sentence.Network_en: He voiced his solidarity with the weak and defenceless.
sentence.Network_cn: 他表示自己同弱势和无助群体站在一起。

sentence.Network_en: He gained the ear of the managing director and voiced his opinion.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说的话总经理愿意倾听,于是他就直抒己见了.

list.abs: 英语动词有主动语态（active voice）和被动语态（passive voice）两种形式。主动语态表示主语是谓语动词动作的执行者，被动语态 …

entry.def: A voiced speech sound is one that is produced with vibration of the vocal cords.

means.word_mean: 1. produced or delivered by the voice; often used in combination;

auth_sentence.content: Rep. Rogers voiced appreciation for Mr. Petraeus's service.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rep. Rogers voiced appreciation for Mr. Petraeus's service.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rep. Rogers voiced appreciation for Mr. Petraeus's service.

auth_sentence.content: Top Russian officials have voiced opposition to the bill.
auth_sentence.res_content: Top Russian officials have voiced opposition to the bill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Top Russian officials have voiced opposition to the bill.

auth_sentence.content: He also voiced frustration with the Israel-Palestinian peace process.
auth_sentence.res_content: He also voiced frustration with the Israel-Palestinian peace process.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He also voiced frustration with the Israel-Palestinian peace process.
